predictPAM: A python module to predict custom PAM sites in any small genome

Initializes and returns a NMSLIB index

Parameters

Returns

Returns a NMSLIB index

Return type

index (nmslib.dist.IntIndex)

predictPAM.main.filter_parse_target(parse_dict, threads=1, levendistance=2)[source]¶

Return a list of features for a genbank file

Parameters

  • parse_dict (dict) – A dictionary with parse target sequence

  • threads (int) – Number of processor threads to use

  • levendistance (int) – Unexcepted Levenshtein edit distance on the distal portion of target sequence from PAM

Returns

List of features with genebank informations

Return type

list

predictPAM.main.get_fastas(filelist, tempdir)[source]¶

Returns Fasta and complement of Fasta for a given Genbank file

Parameters

filelist (str) – Genbank file to process

Returns

Fasta file in forward orientation (5’-3’) reverse.fasta(str): Complement of Fasta file (3’-5’)

Return type

forward.fasta(str)

predictPAM.main.get_nearby_feature(target_mappingfile, featurefile)[source]¶

Adds downstream information to the given target sequences and mapping information

Parameters

  • target_mappingfile (str) – Data in Bedfile format with matches

  • featurefile (list) – List of features with genebank informations

Returns

A file with target sequences, mapping information, and downstream information

Return type

(tsv?? check type of pybed output)

predictPAM.main.get_target(tempdir, mappingdata, targetlength, strand)[source]¶

Given bedfile of PAM locations, function goes up or down and finds target

Parameters

  • tempdir (str) – Temporary directory

  • mappingdata (str) – Bedfile output from map_pam

  • targetlength (int) – Length of the target sequence

  • strand (str) – forward for 5’-3’ or reverse for 3’-5’ orientation

Returns

Bedfile format with matching genes or CDS

Return type

str

predictPAM.main.main(args=None)[source]¶

Run Complete predictPAM workflow.

predictPAM.main.map_pam(tempdir, pamseq, threads, strand)[source]¶

Runs seqkit locate to find the PAM site in the genome (Fasta)

Parameters

  • pamseq (str) – PAM motif

  • threads (int) – Number of processor threads to use

  • strand (str) – forward for 5’-3’ or reverse for 3’-5’ orientation

Returns

Data in Bedfile format with matches

Return type

str

predictPAM.main.merge_downstream_upstream(downsfile, upsfile, columns_name, outputfilename)[source]¶

  • check type of pybed output) – A file with target sequences, mapping information, and downstream information

predictPAM.main.myparser()[source]¶
predictPAM.main.parse_target(targetdict, strand, seqlengthtopam)[source]¶

Given a dictionary of target sequence, parse target sequence into two parts: close region and remaining seq, then create a new dictionary with unique close region sequences as keys

Parameters

  • targetdict (dict) – Dictionary of target sequences obtained after running get_target

  • strand (str) – forward for 5’-3’ or reverse for 3’-5’ orientation

  • seqlengthtopam (int) – Length of conserved sequence close to PAM

Returns

Dictionary with unique close region sequences as keys

Return type

dict
